title: test_thing
text: This file will become your README and also the index of your documentation.

title: test_thing
text:
Developer Guide
If you are new to using nbdev here are some useful pointers to get you started.

Install test_thing in Development mode
# make sure test_thing package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to test_thing
$ nbdev_prepare

title: test_thing
text:
Usage

Installation
Install latest from the GitHub repository:
$ pip install git+https://github.com/yannsay/test_thing.git
or from conda
$ conda install -c yannsay test_thing
or from pypi
$ pip install test_thing


Documentation
Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub repository’s pages. Additionally you can find package manager specific guidelines on conda and pypi respectively.

title: test_thing
text:
How to use
Fill me in please! Don’t forget code examples:

1+1

2



print("hello")

hello

title: main
text:
Exported source
from fasthtml.common import FastHTML, serve




Exported source
app = FastHTML()



@app.get("/")
def home():
    return f"<h1>Hello, World ! {papaya()}</h1>"


import sys


sys.path.append(".")


sys.path.append("../test_thing/")


from components.module1 import *
